message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: private List<SomeType> removeDuplicates(List<SomeType> listWithDuplicates) {
    Map<String, SomeType> map = new HashMap<>();
    List<SomeType> listWithoutDuplicates = new ArrayList<>();

    for (SomeType obj : listWithDuplicates) {
        if (!map.containsKey(obj.getAttribute())) {
            map.put(obj.getAttribute(), obj);
            listWithoutDuplicates.add(obj);
        }
    }

    return listWithoutDuplicates;
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we use a HashMap to keep track of the objects based on their attribute value. We iterate through the list of objects and check if the attribute value is already present in the map. If it is not present, we add the object to the map and the listWithoutDuplicates. This ensures that only one element is added for each value of the attribute.
